text:
Q: Unable to add packages to `uv` project A:

Read the error message:

Operation not permitted (os error 1)

It's not an error with uv or python or whatever, it's an OS level permission error;

Do you have adequate perms? Just try it with sudo, should work just fine.

Q: Why does TFLite INT8 quantization decompose BatchMatMul (from Einsum) into many FullyConnected layers? A:

The answer was simple: there is no support available for complex layers such as Einsum, GRU, etc, so they get split into smaller supported ops that are already supported in tflite framework, for example, in my case fully connected layer. If we really want to support these ops, we need to write our own custom ops, which is not very straightforward, but that's possible xD

Q: Architecture - Conditional Statement & Processing A:

That would also be option, but there many dependencies to build a specific or generic message. Therefore, the parameter list of this function buildMessage would be enourmous.

Q: How to get video from Instagram public access API? A:

All options above dont work anymore in latest instagram, there is this Instaloader package in python that worked for me, not sure about PHP packages though.

Q: Android: how to telnet a phone? A:

To share my experience from 2018, I used the same method as Simon: rooted device, busybox, telnetd started, but connected not from the device but from a laptop, which is more convenient.

  • telnetd started on busybox installed rooted device

  • Use the laptop's "Mobile Hotspot" connection and connect the phone via this Wi-Fi hotspot.

  • Retrieve the socket's IP address using the ipconfig command in the laptop command prompt.

  • telnet IP address

$ uname -a
Linux localhost 3.18.35+ #1 SMP PREEMPT Wed Apr 12 12:54:36 CST 2017 aarch64

Q: How to install Python package eelbrain on macOS A:

It seems that the eelbrain documentation contains the information on how to install it from GitHub: [Installing [Eelbrain]. A branch from GitHub]

The relevant content:

Download the environment file and create the eeldev conda environment:

$ curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/christianbrodbeck/Eelbrain/master/env-dev.yml
$ conda env create --file=env-dev.yml

Activate the environment:

$ conda activate eeldev

Install the relevant development branch into the environment. If installing a specific branch, replace "master" with the branch name:

$ pip install https://github.com/christianbrodbeck/Eelbrain/archive/master.zip

    NOTE: In order for this to work on macOS, the Xcode Command Line Tools need to be installed. If they are not, the pip install command will fail with a long error message including fatal error: 'stdio.h' file not found. In order to install the Command Line Tools, run:

    $ xcode-select --install

I assume xcode-select --install should be done first.

Q: State transition not responding to condition change in AnyLogic A:

Without checking the transition, it is not possible to do give you more feedback. But usually, you cannot have transitions on variable changes. Ideally, you would make a function on the agent setAttribute(newValue), and on this function you could do this.attribute=newValue; send("attribute_set_to_true", this);. And on the transition you have the transition triggered by message.

Now, at the exit of the Delay block, you call the function, which will both change the attribute value and send the message to trigger the transition.
